Systems Biology Workbench (SBW)
 PREV CLASS   NEXT CLASS FRAMES    NO FRAMES
SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

edu.caltech.sbw
Class Sys

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.Sys
public class Sys
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains various utility methods that not part of the SBW API but may be useful for Java programmers. These methods do things like determine the version of the operating system in use, determine the path of the file used to load a particular object class, etc.

Note that since this class is not part of the official API, it is possible it will change more frequently that SBW API changes are made.

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $
Author:
Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $

Method Detail

OSIsWindows

public static final boolean OSIsWindows()
Predicate for testing whether SBW is current on a version of MS Windows.

Returns:
true if Windows, false if other OS

OSIsUnix

public static final boolean OSIsUnix()
Predicate for testing whether SBW is current on a version of Unix (including Darwin) or Linux.

Returns:
true if Unix, false if other OS

OSIsMac

public static final boolean OSIsMac()
Predicate for testing whether SBW is current on a version of Apple MacOS. Note that MacOS X (Darwin) will produce a true result here as well as with OSIsUnix().

Returns:
true if MacOS, false if other OS

getOperatingSystem

public static final int getOperatingSystem()
Returns a code describing the operating system under which SBW is currently running.

Returns:
one of the OS_* constants (such as OS_WINNT)

getHostName

public static final java.lang.String getHostName()
Returns this computer's hostname. This is currently not fully functional except under Linux.

getHostAddress

public static final java.lang.String getHostAddress(java.lang.String host)
Returns this computer's address in string form. This is currently not fully functional except under Linux.

Returns:
a string, the name of this host

safeSleep

public static final void safeSleep(int millis)
Simple method to perform a sleep operation wrapped inside the appropriate try/catch clause. This makes it possible to sleep in an application without writing the surrounding try/catch, as in the following example: ... Sys.safeSleep(500); ...

Parameters:
millis - the number of milliseconds for which to sleep

getJavaExecutable

public static final java.lang.String getJavaExecutable()
Returns the path to the Java executable. The string is suitable for use in constructing "exec" commands. Under Windows, this uses the javaw executable, whereas under other systems it uses the java executable.

Returns:
a string representing the path to the Java executable.

getJavaVersion

public static final int[] getJavaVersion()
Returns an array of three integers, one for each of the major, minor and subminor version numbers in the Java version string. E.g., for JDK release 1.3.1_01, this returns an array such that: array[0] = 1; array[1] = 3; array[2] = 1; This can be useful when testing against specific Java versions in order to make educated guesses about the options they support.

Returns:
an array of three integers containing the numerical equivalents of the Java version string

getFileLoadedForClass

public static final java.io.File getFileLoadedForClass(java.lang.Class c)
Returns the file from which the given class has been loaded in this environment. This is useful for determining the directory in which a given SBW module is located: if the module is packaged in a .jar file and this method is given a class that exists in the .jar file, this method will return the path to the .jar file.

Note that the file return may not always be a .jar file. If you are running within an IDE, the class definition it picks up will most likly be from a .class file located in the project source directory rather than any .jar file. (That is, unless you do something special to make the IDE run from a .jar file.)

Returns:
the file from which the class was loaded by the Java class loader

getCWD

public static final java.lang.String getCWD()
Returns the current directory. This is supposed to be the value of the Java property "user.dir", but we're abstracting it out into a method to allow for more elaborate logic to be added here in the future.

Returns:
the class path as a string

getPropertyAsDir

public static java.io.File getPropertyAsDir(java.lang.String pname)
Method to obtain a system property and return it as a File object representing a directory. It checks that the target is in fact a readable, accessible directory; if not, or the given system property value is null, it returns null.

Parameters:
pname - the string name of a system property.
Returns:
a File object representing the directory.

getPropertyAsDir

public static java.io.File getPropertyAsDir(java.lang.String pname,
                                            java.lang.String deflt)
Method to obtain a system property and return it as a File object representing a directory. It checks that the target is in fact a readable, accessible directory; if not, or the given system property value is null, it returns the value given in parameter default.

Parameters:
pname - the string name of a system property
default - value to use if the property value is null
Returns:
a File object representing the directory

getPropertyAsFile

public static java.io.File getPropertyAsFile(java.lang.String pname)
Method to obtain a system property and return it as a File object representing a file. It checks that the target is in fact a readable, accessible file; if it is not, or the given system property value is null, it returns null.

Parameters:
pname - the string name of a system property.
Returns:
a File object representing the file.

                                             java.lang.String deflt)

Parameters:
pname - the string name of a system property.
Returns:
a File object representing the file.
